result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scorpio M Robinson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Scorpio M Robinson in court.  Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Scorpio M Robinson.  Attorney Ben Wagner for  Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Re: State's request to set over trial dates.
Objection to set over stated by Atty Nagy. Statement by ADA Wagner.
Court makes ruling and grants request for set over for case 21CF31, all other cases to be set as status

Defendant Scorpio M Robinson in court.  Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Scorpio M Robinson.  Attorney Ben Wagner for  Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
and notice of DNA and witness list

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: for Binding Defendant Over for Trial
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: no change, continue to monitor

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: issue $500 bench warrant
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report by (date) TODAY (6/6/2022) at (time) 12:00 PM (NOON). 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

09:13 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
